message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SOC, cs.CL, cs.HC 

The paper focuses on user modeling strategies for inferring user interests on microblogging social networks, which involves collecting and representing user data, constructing and enhancing user interest profiles, and evaluating the constructed profiles. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science, including social networks (cs.SOC), information retrieval (cs.IR), computational linguistics (cs.CL), human-computer interaction (cs.HC), and social and information networks (cs.SI). However, since the paper primarily deals with user modeling and interest inference, we consider cs.SI and cs.IR to be the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.SOC, cs.CL, and cs.HC.
